title: Activists try to stop Kelly Rowland performing at The Everest horse race
text:
Animal rights activists are trying to stop Kelly Rowland from performing at Australia's richest horse race, Daily Mail Australia can reveal.

The former Destiny's Child star, 38, is singing at The Everest at Sydney's Royal Randwick Racecourse on October 19.

The event is a highlight in the racing calendar with 40,000 spectators and prize money of $14million.

But activists are demanding Rowland pull out because they believe the race is cruel to horses which they say are 'mercilessly whipped'.

Animal activists are trying to stop Kelly Rowland (pictured) from performing at Australia's richest horse race, Daily Mail Australia can reveal

Jockey Glen Boss (second from left) rides Kolding to victory during Epsom Handicap Raceday at Royal Randwick Racecourse on Saturday, October 5

Animal rights group People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) has written to Rowland to 'share some information about the race'.

The letter, seen exclusively by Daily Mail Australia, tells Rowland: 'At The Everest, 12 horses will be mercilessly whipped as they're pushed beyond their physical limits to win $14 million for their human owners'.

Rules state a rider can whip the horse five times before the 100-metre mark with unlimited use after that.

PETA's letter says that between July 2018 and August 2019, 122 horses died on Australian racetracks from catastrophic injuries or heart failure.

The letter also notes that since the 1970s more than 3,000 Australian racehorses have been sold to South Korea where they are often slaughtered for meat after their careers.

Earlier this year Daily Mail Australia reported that a half-brother of Winx, one of the most famous racehorses in Australian history, was among those killed for meat at the Jeju Livestock Cooperative abattoir.

Race-goers during Colgate Optic White Stakes Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse in Sydney, Saturday, September 21, 2019

Brenton Avdulla on Come Play With Me wins a race at the Epsom Handicap on October 5, 2019

The letter signs off by urging Rowland, who was a judge on The Voice, to pull out of the event.

It reads: 'We understand that it's hard to gauge the appropriateness of an event while you're touring abroad, but we can assure you that an event profiting from cruelty to horses is an unfit venue for your talents and kindness.

'We sincerely hope you will reconsider giving this performance.'

Rowland announced earlier this month that she was due to perform at the race, which last year was marred by animal rights protesters gathering outside with banners and megaphones.

'I'm coming back Australia - I'm really excited to be returning Down Under to perform at The TAB Everest,' Rowland said.

A horrifying undercover video (pictured) revealed that Australian racehorses are savagely beaten before being slaughtered for meat in South Korea

The Australian Turf Club's Executive General Manager of Commercial, Corina Black said: 'We are delighted to welcome Kelly Rowland to perform as the headline artist in The Theatre of the Horse at this year's Everest at Royal Randwick.

'With 30million records sold as a solo artist, Kelly is a bonafide international star who has a strong connection with her passionate Australian fans.'

It comes after Taylor Swift pulled out of performing at the Melbourne Cup, citing changes to her Asia tour schedule which made it 'logistically impossible' to attend.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Kelly Rowland's representative and The Australian Turf Club for comment.

The Everest is the world's richest race on turf. The Saudi Cup, on dirt, is the richest overall with US$20million prize money.
description: The former Destiny's Child star, 38, is singing at The Everest at Sydney's Royal Randwick Racecourse on October 19. The race, attended by 40,000, is the world's richest.
authors: Charlie Moore For Daily Mail Australia
